channel.title: Not able to run manage database reencrypt $(old) $(new) Error: No such command “reencrypt”
channel.description:
### Issue Summary
I recently found out we need to reencrypt our DB because we used an insecure key. I was trying to follow the instructions here. https://redash.io/help/open-source/admin-guide/secrets but it does not seem that the "manage database" command I am trying to run knows about the command "reencrypt". This is the output. It seems to only know about create_tables drop_tables This is my first time posting. I hope I have included all the information that was needed. I have found older posts to be helpful while setting the instance up so just wanted to say thanks for having this forum!
Usage: manage.py database [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS] Manage the database (create/drop tables). Options: --help Show this message and exit. Commands: create_tables Create the database tables. drop_tables Drop the database tables.
Usage: manage.py database [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]... Error: No such command "reencrypt".
### Technical details:
* Redash Version: docker.io/redash/redash:8.0.2.b37747 * Browser/OS: Firefox 95.0.2 * How did you install Redash: Self hosted redash into AWS ECS.

item.title: Not able to run manage database reencrypt $(old) $(new) Error: No such command “reencrypt”
item.dc:creator: jesse
item.description:
reencrypt is not part of V8. You could potentially implement it yourself if you can’t upgrade to V10. Do so at your own risk.

Read full topic
item.source: Not able to run manage database reencrypt $(old) $(new) Error: No such command “reencrypt”

item.title: Not able to run manage database reencrypt $(old) $(new) Error: No such command “reencrypt”
item.dc:creator: dcarrano
item.description:
Does anyone know if the reencrypt command should be availble in the CLI for Version 8.0.2.b37747? I ask because I do not see it but would really like to reencrypt the database. The page here makes it sound like this should be possible so curious if I am doing something wrong.

GitHub

Build software better, together

GitHub is where people build software. More than 73 million people use GitHub to discover, fork, and contribute to over 200 million projects.

Or is my only option to upgrade to v10.1 and then run the reencrypt? Any information would be a huge help.
Thanks again,
-Dave

Read full topic

item.title: Not able to run manage database reencrypt $(old) $(new) Error: No such command “reencrypt”
item.dc:creator: dcarrano
item.description:
Issue Summary

I recently found out we need to reencrypt our DB because we used an insecure key. I was trying to follow the instructions here.

redash.io

Secret Keys in Redash

but it does not seem that the “manage database” command I am trying to run knows about the command “reencrypt”. This is the output. It seems to only know about create_tables drop_tables
This is my first time posting. I hope I have included all the information that was needed. I have found older posts to be helpful while setting the instance up so just wanted to say thanks for having this forum!

Usage: manage.py database [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]
Manage the database (create/drop tables).
Options:
–help Show this message and exit.
Commands:
create_tables Create the database tables.
drop_tables Drop the database tables.

Usage: manage.py database [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]…
Error: No such command “reencrypt”.

Technical details:

  • Redash Version: docker.io/redash/redash:8.0.2.b37747
  • Browser/OS: Firefox 95.0.2
  • How did you install Redash: Self hosted redash into AWS ECS.

Read full topic
